name: Your Shots Count
description:
The days of your enemies are numbered in Your Shots Count, a game where you protect your village by using your bow and arrow, as well as your math abilities. And don't worry if you are not too confident yet in solving the math expressions from the game, as you can customize your gameplay experience and can practice only one of the math operations that the game has to offer, before selecting more, or selecting them all. You can choose between addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, as well as square roots.

Each enemy that comes towards you has a math expression above their heads, and three answers next to them. Select the right one in order to defeat them.

Your Shots Count is meant to be a way to practice and improve your math skills. Hopefully in a fun way. Enjoy!



Features


  • Spooky atmosphere (and not because of the math!)
  • Easy control scheme: use only the mouse to select an answer.
  • Three unique enemy types: the skeleton moves the fastest, and gains extra speed if you pick the wrong answer; the spellcaster changes their current question when they reach the halfway point, and throw a magical orb towards you for every incorrect answer; the zombie moves the slowest, but has 2HP.
  • Good way to practice your addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, as well as your square roots, as you can find all sorts of shortcuts to solve these math expressions when you are under pressure.
  • Customize your experience by choosing the operations you would like to appear, as well as selecting which enemy types you would like to fight against.
  • Selecting a wrong answer will reset the enemy's current question, but it will also cause the skeleton and spellcaster enemy to react in a way that might make dealing with them a priority.
  • Everything is math in Your Shots Count: replenish your health by shooting at the HP item that the bat will sometimes bring on the battlefield.
